intro: Alsine intricata, commonly known as the intricate sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit and small, white to pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh, dry environments it inhabits. Alsine intricata is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun and requiring minimal water.
